titleStmt.title: The wooing lasse, and the way-ward lad, who long had made his sweet-heart sad, because to her hee would not yeeld, till Cupid him to love compeld. To the tune of The nightingale.
titleStmt.author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?

publicationStmt.publisher: for I. Wright junior, dwelling at the upper end of the Old Baily,

notesStmt.note: In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the upper end of the Old Baily
